page.title: 03Kettlethorpe/Fenton Housing
page.content: Several large houses in Fenton are empty and derelict. Semi-detached council houses built in 1930s and old tied cottages are occupied,mainly by farm workers.'Infill' private housing was built in 1970s/80sfor people wanting to live in the country and able by affluence and cheap petrol to commute.A terraced block of small old houses was demolished in 1960s and replaced by council flats/maisonettes for local elderly people. Following government policy to sell council houses half are now owner occupied. Kettlethorpe Hall is still a family home; the estate was sold in 1946. Apart from three pairs of council houses in 1930s there was no building until 1960s/70s, when three dwellings were built in the old Rectory grounds. House construction mainly red brick and pantiles. House sales are slow.
